question: The "Great Belt Fixed Link/Bridge" is located in which country?
explanation: Great Belt Fixed Link/Bridge is located in Denmark. Great Belt Bridge is a bridge constructed across the Great Belt Strait to connect the Zealand Islands and Funen Islands of Denmark. It was constructed between 1991 and 1998. It was officially named as the East Bridge. It is the world's fifth-longest suspension bridge according to their main span (i.e., the length of suspended roadway between the bridge's towers). The Great Belt Fixed Link and the Oresund Bridge made possible the connectivity between Central-Western Europe and Scandinavia by road.
